Nemesis Enforcer/Scattershot:



Nemesis Enforcer was deep in thought as he rode a thermal, his eyes barely 
able to take the light.  His animal form was nocturnal, and didn't like 
bright lights!  And that damn star (the Sun) was blazing right into his 
sensetive optic sensors.  When he got back to base, he'd have to do something 
about them.

He thought a little longer, two thirds of the way to the Iron Fist and 
relocated Alliance Base.  He looked to his right at Scattershot, who was 
chasing a fish near the surface of the water.

Nemesis sighed at the bald eagle, opening a comlink to Zardus.
"Zardus, it's Nemesis Enforcer.  I've been thinking about things, and I think 
we need to make a few modifications to the defenses of the island."

"First, I was wondering if the shields which cover the island go all the way 
down to the bottom of the sea bed?  If not, people could swim under the 
shields and gain access, possible.  Now, to combat that possibility, I was 
thinking making it possible for the shields touch down to the sea bed.  Also, 
we could have underwater mines and torpedo tubes underwater."

Nemesis awaited for a response, raising in altitude twenty feet, not wanting 
Scattershot to hear him.
